prompt: A carousel navigation arrow with a white arrow icon and a blue circle background

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The carousel navigation arrow should have a blue circle background with a white arrow icon inside. The arrow icon should be pointing towards the direction of navigation (e.g., left or right). The component should be easily clickable on all screen sizes, with a subtle hover effect to indicate interactivity. **Components:** 1. **CarouselNavArrow** (Takes Children): This component represents a single navigation arrow in the carousel. **Top-level UI HTML:** ```html
``` **Component HTML:** - **CarouselNavArrow** (Takes Children): ```html ``` Note: The `direction` prop is not included in the HTML as it is not a visual aspect of the component. It can be used to determine the arrow icon and direction in the implementation.

prompt: A prominent hero banner with a large background image and white text overlay

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The UI should have a prominent hero banner that takes up the full width of the screen. The hero banner should have a large background image that scales to fit the screen size. On top of the background image, there should be a white text overlay with a clear call-to-action (CTA). The hero banner should be the first thing that catches the user's attention when they land on the page. **Components** 1. **HeroBanner** (Takes Children): A prominent hero banner that takes up the full width of the screen. It should have a large background image and a white text overlay. 2. **HeroBackground** (Standalone): A large background image that scales to fit the screen size. 3. **HeroOverlay** (Takes Children): A white text overlay that sits on top of the background image. **Top Level HTML** ```html

{header_text}

{subheader_text}
``` **Component HTML** - **HeroBanner** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - **HeroBackground** (Standalone): ```html ``` - **HeroOverlay** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
```

prompt: A post list component that displays a list of article titles, summaries, and thumbnails in a grid layout

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The Post List component should display a grid of post items, with each item containing a thumbnail, title, and summary. The grid should be responsive, with a maximum of 3 columns on large screens, 2 columns on medium screens, and 1 column on small screens. The thumbnails should be square and take up a significant portion of the grid item. The title and summary should be displayed below the thumbnail, with the title in a larger font size and the summary in a smaller font size. The entire component should have a subtle background gradient to give it some depth. **Individual components:** 1. PostListItem (Takes Children): This component represents a single post item in the grid. It should contain a thumbnail, title, and summary. 2. PostList (Takes Children): This component represents the entire grid of post items. It should contain multiple PostListItem components. **HTML for top-level UI:** ```html
``` **HTML for each component:** - PostListItem (Takes Children): ```html

{title}

{summary}

``` - PostList (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` Note: `{thumbnail_url}`, `{title}`, and `{summary}` are placeholders for the actual values that will be rendered.

prompt: A navigation menu with links to different sports categories (e.g. NFL, NBA, MLB) and a search bar with a white background and dark text

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The navigation menu should be a horizontal list of links to different sports categories, with a search bar at the end. The search bar should have a white background and dark text. The menu should be responsive, with the links wrapping to a new line on smaller screens. The search bar should be full-width on smaller screens and shrink to a fixed width on larger screens. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. **NavLink** (Standalone): A single link in the navigation menu. Should be a horizontal list item on larger screens and a vertical list item on smaller screens. 2. **SearchBar** (Standalone): A search input with a white background and dark text. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
  • NFL
  • NBA
  • MLB
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - **NavLink** (Standalone): ```html ``` - **SearchBar** (Standalone): ```html
``` Note: `{link_href}` and `{link_text}` are placeholders for the link URL and text, respectively.

prompt: A navigation menu with white text on a dark blue background (#212121)

message.content:
What should the UI look like? The navigation menu should have a dark blue background with white text. The menu items should be vertically stacked on small screens and horizontally stacked on larger screens. The menu should take up the full width of the screen on small screens and be contained in a fixed-width container on larger screens. What are the individual components that make up the UI? 1. **NavigationBar** (Standalone): This is the top-level component that contains the navigation menu. It should have a dark blue background and white text. 2. **NavItem** (Takes Children): This component represents a single menu item. It should display the text and any icons provided as children. On small screens, it should take up the full width of the screen, and on larger screens, it should be horizontally stacked with other NavItems. What does the HTML for top level UI look like? ```html
Home About Contact
``` What is the HTML for each component? - **NavigationBar** (Standalone): ```html
{children}
``` - **NavItem** (Takes Children): ```html

prompt: A photo gallery component featuring a grid of square images with a light gray border and a hover effect

message.content:
**UI Design** The photo gallery component should resemble a responsive, accessible, and visually appealing grid of square images with a light gray border and a hover effect. The grid should scale according to different screen sizes, making it easy to navigate and view the images. **Components** 1. `PhotoGallery` (Takes Children): A container component for the photo gallery, which takes an array of `Photo` components as children. 2. `Photo` (Standalone): A single photo component, which displays a square image with a light gray border and a hover effect. **Top Level UI HTML** ```html

prompt: A component to display a list of event organizers, with images and bios

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The UI should display a list of event organizers, each with their image, name, and bio. The list should be responsive, Scaling down to a single column on smaller screens. The images should be circular and overlaid with a slight shadow to give depth. The bios should be concise and easy to read. The UI should have a consistent color palette, with highlight colors used to make important information stand out. **Individual Components** 1. `OrganizerCard` (Takes Children): A card component that displays an event organizer's information. * On small screens, the image takes up the full width, and the bio is displayed below. * On medium screens and up, the image is floated to the left, and the bio is displayed to the right. * Purpose: To display an event organizer's information in a concise and visually appealing way. 2. `OrganizerList` (Takes Children): A list component that displays a list of `OrganizerCard`s. * On small screens, the list is a single column. * On medium screens and up, the list is a grid with two columns. * Purpose: To display a list of event organizers in a responsive and easy-to-navigate format. **Top Level UI HTML** ```html

Event Organizers

``` **Component HTML** - `OrganizerCard` (Takes Children): ```html

{name}

{bio}

``` - `OrganizerList` (Takes Children): ```html
    {children}
``` Note: `{image_url}`, `{name}`, and `{bio}` are placeholders for the actual values that will be passed to the component.

prompt: A top navigation bar with a logo, search bar, and links to login/register, About Us, and Contact Us pages

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The top navigation bar should be a sticky header that remains at the top of the screen as the user scrolls. It should have a consistent design language throughout, with a prominent logo on the left, a search bar in the center, and links to important pages on the right. The logo should be easily clickable on mobile devices. The search bar should be easily accessible and have a clear input field with a submit button. The links to login/register, About Us, and Contact Us pages should be clear and easily clickable. The navigation bar should adapt to different screen sizes, with the search bar becoming smaller on smaller screens and the links stacking vertically on mobile devices. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** * **NavBar** (Standalone): The top navigation bar that contains all the components. * **Logo** (Standalone): The logo of the website, displayed on the left side of the navigation bar. * **SearchBar** (Takes Children): A search input field with a submit button. * **NavLink** (Standalone): A single link to a page, such as login/register, About Us, or Contact Us. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
{children}
  • Log in/Register
  • About Us
  • Contact Us
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** * **NavBar** (Standalone): ```html
{children}
``` * **Logo** (Standalone): ```html ``` * **SearchBar** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` * **NavLink** (Standalone): ```html { NavLink.text } ```

prompt: Create a hero image component with a full-width background image and a green overlay

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The Hero Image component should have a full-width background image that scales responsively on different screen sizes. On top of the background image, there should be a green overlay that adds a pop of color and helps draw attention to the component. The overlay should be semi-transparent to allow the background image to still be visible. The component should be easy to use and navigate, with clear typography and sufficient contrast. **Individual Components** * HeroImage (Takes Children): A full-width Hero Image component with a background image and a green overlay. **Top Level UI HTML** ```html
